content:
Can someone review https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/95256 ?

The bug it fixes is a regression (from stable to beta) and it would nice to get it in the next beta so that the regression doesn't actually hit stable. Or something like that.

At the very least, if the regression hits stable, it seems like it should be a more deliberate decision than something like nobody having gotten around to reviewing the code in time.

The associated issue is marked for prioritization, so it should get some attention soonish, I think. Once it's prioritized high enough the release team will catch it at the latest if someone else doesn't review it by then. At least that's how I understand th eprocesses.
